author: squareduck
title: Best of the series.
review:
Awesome figure, this makes a great addition as a special response team minifig for the local fire department. The figure is noticeably lighter in color than pictured, being actually closer to yellow than orange. The Helmet is one piece with the visor installed and a stud on the back to connect the tool hose. It may be possible to pop the visor out if you felt the need. The tool is one piece made from the semi-flexible plastic and fits wonderfully into the stud on the back.


Pros: Great new helmet and tool. Perfect figure for a specialized response team.


Cons: None!


Pick him up for sure!

author: xccj
title: Hazmat Guy to the Rescue
review:
This is certainly one of the better figs in Series 4.  The new suit piece is really amazing, with a built in visor, tubing details, and the hazmat symbol on the front.  The back also reuses the design found in some of the older Aquazone suits, with a kind of fan details with a stud.  The rubber hose tool wraps around the fig and fits securely into that stud, which is nice.  The rubber hose is a nice design, and can easily be used in multiple ways in other MOCs.  Unfortunately, I did start to notice some wear on it (where the hand grips it) after a couple of days of play.

 

The rest of the fig is pretty cool tool.  The torso and legs come in the same light orange color as the suit, and the torso has some good printing on it to make it look good even with the main suit off.  And, of course, the frightened head totally gives life to this character.

 

All in all, this is a new idea that hasn't been used before, and the minifigure comes with some cool new parts.  (Not to mention that he comes in a fairly new color for minifigures).  He would be a great grab if you discover him in one of your Series 4 minifigure bags.

author: flyingjoseph
title: Best minifigure in S4
review:
In my opinion,this is the best minifigure in S4.Now on to the Pros and Cons:
                                                                                                         
       Pros:
             1.Awsome helmet piece.
             2.Scared face.
             3.Easy to find.

     Cons:
             1.Um......

         Overall:I would recommend this minifigure to a friend.

author: clundsberg
title: Lego Sceptic Tank CLEAR!
review:
Ah yes, many a time while staring down my toilette, plunger in hand, have I given the same look as this poor hazmat guy.  Although he has the benefit of an airtight radiation suit :/

FINALLY!  I found minifigures!  These elusive little buggers which are usually consumed by the boxfull were found at a local Target!  Looking at the front package, I hoped for the punk rocker or perhaps the mad scientist.  Once I saw the entire list, Hazmat became my #1 choice.

Apparently the most wanted of all minifures, Hazmat is very original as I cannot think of any set that would contain such figures.  The expression on his face, the original molded helmet (clear face shield does not move), the gun or detector unit is which plugs in nicely to the helmet's backside and the orange/black colour scheme all make this a truley unique and collectible figure.

Having a team of these guys (different heads of course - maybe using the Alpha team heads) would be a fun little addition to a town with a bunch of lego zombies.

I wish everyone the best of luck in their minifure collections if they are hoping to score this guy!

author: wander099
title: Unfortunate Timing
review:
Unfortunately, this is not good timing for this figure to come out considering what is happening in Japan.  But this figure is really nice and easy to find.  The helmet is large and as such is easy to identify.

Helmet:

The helmet is amazing.  You can see his face through the clear plastic window and there is a printed radioactive symbol on the front.  In addition, there is an attachment on the back where the sprayer tube is attached.  It fits very well and is quite well designed.

Head:

The facial expression is great, though perhaps a bit disconcerting.  It is a face of utter panic and fear and can be seen clearly through the clear plastic window.  I love the overall look of this.

Torso:

The torso is printed on the front only and has a belt that can be seen with the helmet on and another radioactive symbol that is hidden when he wears the helmet.

Legs:

The legs are plain, but they are a shade of orange (like the other pieces) that I have not seen before in minifigures.  I think the colour is particularly wonderful.

Sprayer:

This accessory fits well in the figure's hand and attaches securely in the back of the helmet.

Overall:

A great figure.  I particularly enjoy the new orange colour and the radioactive symbols.  I'm not sure how common this figure is, but it is, like the geisha, very easy to find by touch if one is in the box.

author: K_nut
title: Here I am! Ready to clean up the... wait, what's that?
review:
When going down to Woodfield mall in Schaumburg, IL, I was surprised to see both Series 3 and 4 side by side. I knew I had to pick up as many Series 4 as possible! For me, that was five.

The Packaging

The packaging is exactly the same as all minfig bags. I found Series 4 to be the hardest to do the touch and feel with, though the Hazmat Guy is an easier one with the helmet.

The Minifig

The Hazmat guy is awesome. That's about all I can say. The Hazmat Guy consists of 5 pieces, not including the stand. The Hazmat guy does not have back printing like the Geisha and Soccer Player, but that's okay because the helmet covers most of his back. Sadly, the visor does not come off of the helmet. The sprayer has a hose on it so it can be attached to the back of the helmet, as Whitefang show's it here with the entire series. http://www.eurobricks.com/forum/index.php?showtopic=52837http://acapsoft.com/ceb/a/u/10003/85~0.jpg

The conclusion

The Hazmat guy has to be one of the best minifigs around. If you don't get this, you'll regret it!

author: alva
title: Best Minifig in Collection 4
review:
Since the first time I saw the photos of Minifig Collection 4, I know that this minifig is the best of them all. Just got mine yesterday while shopping in a bookstore near my home, and this is truly the best of them all.

I like the color of the suit, the orange color is really bright and nice. I also like the headgear. It act as a headgear and as well as a body armor. Really nicely design. And it also has a socket on the back to attack the spray gun and a nuclear symbol on the chest. Really cool!

Not like the visor for a racer and a driver, this minifig visor can not be moved. Quite realistic, cause if you handling a hazardous material and you can open the visor, then you probably can die.

The face is also quite nice. Very realistically scared:P

I can imagine the use of this minifig in a lot of MOC. Probably some kind of Nuclear Generator Plant? Or probably some kind of Games MOC? You name it.

I really recommend you to get at least one of this minifig!

author: LEGO_MY_EGO
title: Hazmat Guy Patrolling my Lego city!
review:
The hazmat guy is one of the best mini figures lego has made. When you see the mystery bags you can easily feel the big helmet of the hazmat guy. Now lets get started with the pros of this guy...

Pros:

cool helmet
nice new color
awesome spray gun
nice caution symbols

Cons:

You can't take the lens of the helmet.

I hope this review helped you decide if you want this guy for your collection. See ya!

author: AETerry
title: Hazmat Guy Review
review:
I'm not a huge games fan, but the movie Back to the Future comes to mind when I see this minifigure. I like him enough to have found and gotten two and as my little one would like me to get another Ice Skater and Geisha (for the fan accessory), I may try to see if I can get a couple more of this one for MOCing.

 

The orange coloring and radiation print design on the torse are very well done. His helmet piece is well detailed and molded, especially with the clear visor that's made so the helmet doesn't open up. I like the expression on the minifigure's face of fear and extreme worry. Finishing out this minifigure is the nozzle spray gun and it's hose piece that connects to the back of the suit.

 

He's not my favorite of all the minifigures in Series 4, but he certianly is enjoyable to display and look at.

author: BrickTVReviews
title: Could a LEGO City Hazmat Subtheme Possible?
review:
Hello welcome and I am gonna review set 8804 Collectable Minifigures Series 4. The Hazmat Guy is one of the best and fist collectable minifig series 4 that I bought. Anyway

Level Of Difficulty

The top helmet is one piece and the visor is clipped in with the helmet so this could be the largest easisest piece to search for because there aren't any wimilar pieces in S4. Easy to find.

 

Pieces

They are pretty promising....

Among the 2 accesories is a gun and a helmet mask.The gun is made from rubber. There are dtails on the gun and helmet i.e locking handles on the helmet and handle in gun. The gun should be connected to the back of the helmet.

 

Model [Finished]

The minifigure is great! Its the first time TLC is doing a hazmat miniman. Nothing I could say here, maybe it's exclusiveness is why fans love it, it's one of the best S4 minis.

 

Story Corner

As stated in title: "Could a LEGO City Hazmat Subtheme Possible?"

maybe no, Eurobricks member LightningTiger said that a NEW Paradisa like subtheme and/or theme is coming in 2012. Not counting that there are rumors floating in Eurobricks that a new Police and Coast Guard hybrid subtheme is coming in 2012 or 2013 and not also counting the fact that the Cargo and Emergency subthemes could go back in production next year so it is unlikely for Hazmat subtheme coming next year.

 

Final Verdict

Following the easy to search helmet and it's exclusiveness you should get this before S5 comes out in July or August.

author: The_Mimed_One
title: Dead end, but cute!
review:
The Hazmat Guy is here, finally, to fix everybody's tap water or power plant!
I really am glad to see TLG make one, but did the color seem appropriate?

I may be eating my own words here, what with this color showing up more
and more, but honestly, what was TLG thinking?

The head is great, since the minifigures always seem too happy; it is hard to find
worried faces. The gun is awkward, but maybe with the old Aquaraiders full-body
helmets, the gun will work better.

I do have a dozen of these (13 if you count my open one,) So I do like them.

Yes

Great face

Overall idea


No

Horrid color (at least in terms of compatibility)

Odd gun

author: Cheez99
title: Haz-Mat Review
review:
This is only my second review so don't criticize me to much. The Haz-Mat minifigure definitely the best collectable in set 4. He is perfect for any situation: A lego house is on fire and there are chemicals in there. No normal firefighters could just go in, they need the Haz-Mat guy.

   I know that this sounds kind of childish, but for all those people that like to play with their Legos, this guy is ready also.

   This Lego figure has an awesome helmet, the "Hazardous Materials" symbol and to top it all off... is in an exelent shade of orange and black hands. He also has a Haz-Mat gun which makes him that much more awesome.

   To really sum it all up, awesome minifigure. I would most definitley reccomend this minifigure to anyone.

author: GeluNumber1
title: Hazmat's a good buy
review:
Hazmat Guy is, in a single word, greatness.

  First, he's easy to find in a sea of packets. He has a bulky helmet, so you can feel it right away. And he has special bumps on his packet.

  His parts are awesome. Again, the helmet. It's unique to this one set. The back has an encircled fan, with an indentation in the middle where the tube/nozzle/sucker thing connects. And that part, too, is only found here. His head has a comical look, furrowed in fear. The torso is decorated with a hazmat sign, and some wrinkles. The legs are normal. Oh, and all but the head are orange.

  The buld is really simple: Snap all the parts together, and connect the hose to the back. That's all there is.

  The playability is minimal. Sure, you can pose him and set him in a diorama, but that's it.

  Overall, Hazmat Guy's actually a good buy if you're a collector, if you want rare parts, or if you just think he looks cool. I recommend him.

author: kaptainkool
title: very cool figure in quality
review:
Wow, this figure is amazing. The helmet is cool. The suit is actually a lighter orange color. There is a hazard logo on his torso and helmet. His scared face is funny and you could possibly use it in an MOC. The gun is new and if you don't like it in his hand, you can put it in a Star Wars minifigures hand and make a bounty hunter or whatever.

Pros

  • disintegrator gun
  • suit
  • color

Cons

  • visor can't pop out

  •    <<< lol a random brick :)

I highly recommend you get this minifigure since it is in my opinion the coolest, although the musketeer is my favorite. Bye.

author: Shistavanen_brick
title: Point me towards danger!
review:
The figure.


This is one of the must-have figures from series 4. The entire figure and parts of it can easily be fitted to suit your own MOC in many of the LEGO themes. A bunch of these could play an important part in say, Alien conquest. Or perhaps put it in a Space (or Star Wars) setting. The sculpt for the helmet is just sweet and the face show a really scared guy. The "gun" attaches well (so far) to the back of the helmet.


The only real problem I see is that the colour of the helmet and the body seems to be a bit out of tune. It looks a little bit like a pale orange colour on the torso and legs, while the helmet is a bit on the stronger side. I also fear that maybe either the gun or its tubing might break, for some reason. It feels like it's made of a cheaper plastic.


Pros

  • Overall nice design and printing.
  • Cool helmet and "gun".

Cons

  • Maybe the colour is a bit out of tune.


At the end of the day, this minifig is great and you'd better get at least one. Who knows when it will come in handy?

author: tkettle9719
title: Poison Control!
review:
I got this set for myself at Borders, along with the Crazy Scientist, and copies of Longitude and Animal Farm, and think that this is a superior minifig.

Pros

  • -The orange here is great.
  • -The poison gun is great also.
  • …

Cons

  • -Leg printing would be nice.
  • -The piece for the bug killer is a bit hard to control.
  • …

This is an excellent little minifigure, and it comes with many great little parts. I highly recommend this set to all exterminators.

author: sideswinger
title: one AWESOME CMF!
review:
The thirteenth figure in the LEGO Minifigures Series 4 is the Hazmat Guy. This figure includes 6 pieces, was released in 2011, and retailed for three dollars. So let's take a closer look!

So on top we have that mask piece, and that might be the best part of this figure. I just love so much about it. On top, we have that little round moulding, which is cool, and the back has some really awesome moulding too, as does the front. I also love the black printing on the front too. But I think my favourite part of the mould is probably the dual-moulded transparent plastic in the front. That looks really fantastic. That piece was new for the figure as well. Overall, that piece is not only incredible for 2011, but is incredible to this day, and is one of the best pieces in this whole series.

Next is his face, which is another incredible part. It has a very worried expression, which I am just in love with. That face is exclusive, and it's one of my favourite worried expressions ever. He has no alternate face, but that's okay.

Next is his torso, which is yet another amazing piece. It has some really awesome printing, with the black belt on the bottom, and there's even printing under that mask piece, which is incredible considering it can't be seen without removing the mask. He has no back torso printing.

Next is his legs, which have no printing. However, I do really appreciate how the top section is black and the legs themselves are orange.

And on top of a really amazing figure, he even has an accessory. He includes that little black sprayer piece, which even connects to the back of the mask using a pole connection, if I'm not mistaking. All in all, that's just a great piece.

And that's it for the figure! As a whole, this is one of the best figures in the series, if not my favourites of all. And even better, this one of my favourite CMF's ever. I just love this thing so darn much. The pieces are amazing, the colours are cool, the prints are fantastic, and the price of three dollars isn't bad either. All in all, this is a great figure. As always, check out my profile as well as my other reviews, and thanks for reading!
